Mourvedre is exotic, sultry, and intriguing. Widely planted
in Spain and France—also known as Mataro and
Monastrell—its unique character never ceases to amaze.
It can be finicky, but put the grape in the right location,
and a special wine emerges. The Fore Family Vineyard at
3000 feet elevation on Cobb Mountain is the perfect spot,
coaxing out effusive aromas and flavors of anise,
raspberry, white pepper, and pink grapefruit.

finding the ideal vineyard site,” which is a lot easier said than
done. | walked a lot of vineyards before finding Skyfall, named for

literally look like they fell from the sky. These boulders were

PROPRIETOR’S RESERVE

2015 CHARDONNAY
CENTRAL COAST

Our Proprietor’s Reserve Chardonnay is all about raising the bar. We began
by sourcing fruit of exceptional depth, possessing both abundant flavor and
perfectly balanced acidity. The juice was fermented then subsequently aged
in 100% French Oak on moderately heavy lees. Persistent stirring of the
lees built richness on the mid-palate all the while keeping the wine bright
and fresh. Our 2015 Proprietor’s Reserve Chardonnay is the culmination
of a tremendous effort and one taste will show it was time well spent.

The key to success? When Jim Nantz and Peter Deutsch met,
they discovered they both found success by pursuing a calling
in life. For Jim, that calling was to unlock the voice within,
eventually calling the greatest sporting events of his genera-
tion. And for Peter, it was transforming a small family
business into one of the most prestigious wine companies in
the world. Inspired by their mentor fathers and guided by
their common values, the two found a new calling: a
partnership to produce hand-crafted wines that bear the
standard of excellence and style that are the hallmarks of these
two men. The Calling. Have you unlocked yours?

and excellence. We hope you enjoy drinking it as much as we

enjoyed making it. Cheers!

2014 Jamison Valley Vineyard Pinot Noir
Destein Estate
Sennett Valley
This is our second bottling from this tiny AVA. The vineyard sits on a west-facing slope in a minor
valley at the east end of Bennett Valley proper. It takes the brunt of cool air flowing through the
Petaluma Gap from the Pacific Ocean, allowing ample flavor development through generous
hang time resulting from cool growing season temperatures. The vines are small, with a great
natural balance and small fruit load that is the result of scanty, non-vigorous soils.
Soil Type: gravely volcanic mudflow Barrel Aging: 21 months, 50% new French oak
Elevation: 565’-625° Terrain: west facing slope
Year Planted: 1996 Harvest Date: September 20, 2014
Clone: Dijon clone 777 .
59 cases produced

2015 VIOGNIER CENTRAL COAST
Calera’s 2015 Central Coast Viognier is made from grapes grown by the
following vineyard in California’s Central Coast Viticultural Area:
Gimelli Vineyard San Benito County 100%

After hand harvesting, the whole grape clusters were pressed and the
juice was moved by gravity to Calera’s barrel cellar.

Fermentation in 80% neutral oak barrels and 20% concrete tank was
followed by complete malolactic fermentation. The wine was aged in
its respective fermentation vessels for cight months.

MALBEC
Conquista (Conquest) is almost a synonym of Argentina: the Spaniards as
early as the 16th century followed by the Jesuits and more recently European
immigrants notably Italians, were all fascinated by the beauty and richness of
the land. The result is a combination of warmth, style, and tradition just like
this wine. Situated at the foothills of the Antes and fed hy the purest water
from melted snow, the vineyards produce grapes of outstanding quality. Made
to enjoy, this wine with spiced red plum flavours combined with this silky
texture should Conquista you at any time of the day.

creamy nuttiness with a steely backbone like no other wine. Its elusiveness and

2009, we harvested a tiny amount of the very first Chardonnay from Stewart
Ranch. The magic and mystery of both the vineyard and winemaking came
together, resulting in a wine that exceeded our expectations.

Located in beautiful Northeast Texas, Crooked Creek Vineyards
is dedicated to the art of winemaking. Our initial plantings were
of Lenoir (also known as Black Spanish Grapes) and Blanc du
Bois. We have planted, cultivated, pruned and picked, and the
hard work and dedication to our craft are presented to you in
this delightfully light and fruity Lenoir. Our wine is hand-crafted
in small crushings, allowing us to take painstaking and meticulous
care in the production of our wines. We hope that you will take
as much pleasure in the enjoyment of our wine, as we have had
in bringing it to you. Enjoy!

122:
ALEXANDER
VALLEY
VINEYARDS

2015 dry ROSE of SANGIOVESE

 

Small Sangiovese vineyards are farmed exclusively for this rosé.

Heavy pruning promotes even ripening while maintaining
acidity and minerality in the grapes. We leave the juice in
contact with the skins for a few hours to achieve the perfect pink
hue, then cold ferment in stainless steel to maintain the bright
flavors. Our dry Rosé of Sangiovese jumps out of the glass with
intense aromatics and is rich and full bodied with big flavors of
strawberry, watermelon, raspberry and mint. The Wetzel
Family Estate, located on the property settled in the 1840s by
Alexander Valley namesake Cyrus Alexander, showcases the
history, tradition and excellence of the region.

Our Reserve Riesling is produced only in years when ripening
conditions are outstanding. The wine in this bottle has a zesty
acidity, beguiling complexity, and a creamy mouthfeel. Look for
aromas of lemongrass, lime and mango. These delicate flavors pair
exceptionally well with lime-marinated beef, chicken fajitas, and
swordfish steaks with mango salsa as well as Thai beef salad.
Paired with foods that feature soy sauce or ginger, our Reserve
Riesling provides a dazzling taste experience.

nny’ | Yakima Valley

For over four generations, our family has been
farming in the Yakima Valley. With a great love
for the land, our founder H. Lloyd Miller planted
trees throughout his farm. Over the years most of
the original trees disappeared, with the exception
of one Lone Birch, which stands at the corner of
our vineyard. With many years on its roots, this
tree has become a symbol of strength for our
farm. It provides shade to workers, direction to
lost travelers, inspiration to our family, and serves
as a reminder of our commitment to care for

the land. Learn more about our wines and our
commitment to stewardship and sustainability at
www.lonebirchwines.com.

2009 VIOGNIER CENTRAL COAST

Calera’s 2009 Central Coast Viognier is made from grapes grown by the
following vineyards in California’s Central Coast Viticultural Area:

Guerra Vineyard San Benito County 57%
Gimelli Vineyard San Benito County 43%

After hand harvesting, the whole grape clusters were pressed and the
juice was moved by gravity to Calera’s barrel cellar.

Fermentation in barrels by native yeasts was followed by complete
malolactic fermentation. The wine was aged without racking in
neutral French oak barrels for seven months. The separate vineyard
lots were combined prior to bottling.

2015 PINOT GRIS

My grandfather would always tell me, “great wine starts with
finding the ideal vineyard site,” which is a lot easier said than
done. | walked a lot of vineyards before finding Skyfall, named
for the massive car-sized boulders scattered among the vines
that literally look like they fell from the sky. These boulders
were brought by glacial floods of the last Ice Age along with
silt loam soils now layered with ancient volcanic ash. The
complexity of these soils is ideal for cultivating optimal flavors
in the grapes, making Skyfall a perfect vineyard site.

VINEYAROD S

Lenotr

Located in beautiful Northeast Texas, Crooked Creek Vineyards
is dedicated to the art of winemaking. Our initial plantings were
of Lenoir (also known as Black Spanish Grapes) and Blanc du
Bois. We have planted, cultivated, pruned and picked, and the
hard work and dedication to our craft are presented to you in
this delightfully light and fruity Lenoir. Our wine is hand-crafted
in small crushings, allowing us to take painstaking and meticulous
care in the production of our wines. We hope that you will take
as much pleasure in the enjoyment of our wine, as we have had
in bringing it to you. Enjoy!

My grandfather would always tell me, “great wine starts with
finding the ideal vineyard site,” which is a lot easier said than
done. | walked a lot of vineyards before finding Skyfall, named
for the massive car-sized boulders scattered among the vines
that literally look like they fell from the sky. These boulders
were brought by glacial floods of the last Ice Age along with
silt loam soils now layered with ancient volcanic ash. The
complexity of these soils is ideal for cultivating optimal flavors
in the grapes, making Skyfall a perfect vineyard site.

Calera’s 2015 Central Coast Chardonnay is made from grapes grown by the
following selected vineyards in California’s Central Coast Viticultural Area:

Pedregal Vineyard San Benito County 23%
Laetitia Vineyard San Luis Obispo County 21%
Sierra Madre Vineyard Santa Barbara County 15%
Chalone Vineyard Monterey County 11%
Bien Nacido Vineyard Santa Barbara County 10%
Lone Oak Vineyard Monterey County 10%
Zabala Vineyard Monterey County 10%

After hand harvesting, the whole grape clusters were pressed and the juice
was moved by gravity to Calera’s barrel cellar. Fermentation in barrels by
native ycasts was followed by complete malolactic fermentation. The wine
was aged without racking in French oak barrels, 10% new, for ten months.
The separate vineyard lots were combined prior to bottling.

2002 (sS

YAKIMA VALLEY

Late Harvest Pinot Gris
Proprietor’s Notes cn Mount Baker Vineyard’s 2002 Pinot Gris

The 2002 growing season was long and hot; with no measurable precipitation in the
months of June or July, providing perfect conditions for the Late Harvest Pinot Gris. The
grapes were left to hang through two weeks of hard freeze and were finally hand picked
November 18, 2002; two weeks past the bulk of the harvest year,

The clusters were beginning to raisin, and upon arrival at the crush pad, we were very
pleased to find the grapes enormously flavorful end quite aromatic, Pressing.the grapes
yielded less than 100 gallons of juice per ton.

This wine is bursting with pear, pineapple and apricot aroma. Once on the palate, the
wine opens with a full-bodied and well-balanced sensation of tropical fruit. The finish is
lingering and rewarding, malting the Late Harvest Pinot Gris the perfect finish for a
celebratory evening,

The juice was inoculated in a stainless steel tank and kept outside in the November air for
the entire process. The high natural sugar (37.5 brix), combined with the mid-forties tank
temperature resulted in a slow, very controlled cold ferment and kept all bitterness’s at a
minimum. The BA11 yeast used promotes clean, aromatic characteristics and intensifies
mouth-fee] and lingering flavors. The 5% Siegerrebe addition seems to have enabled the
product to avoid that heavy cloying sense that so many dessert wines possess. The fresh
fruit aromas of orange blossom, pineapple and apricot are enhanced, adding to the
bouquet, taste and finish of this wine.

Analysis: Harvest Sugar: 37.5 brix
Residual Sugars: 14.5%
Alcohol: 9.0%
Titratable acids 0.81%
Ph 3.03%

Blend: 95% Pinat Gris, 5% Siegerrebe

Vineyards: Pinot Gris: = Crawford Vineyards
Siegerrebe: Mount Baker Vineyards

249:
2016 ALIGOTE MT. HARLAN

Aligoté, pronounced “Al” (a man’s name) - “ee” — “go” (get moving) — “tay,”
is almost completely unknown in the United States. Only a handful of
Burgundian producers’ Aligotés are imported into this country, and Calera is
one of the very first U.S. wineries to produce the variety. Aligoté is the
“other” white variety in Burgundy, after Chardonnay, and has both higher

yields and higher acidity than its more famous counterpart.

Our two tiny parcels came about when we grafted about 330 vines over to
Aligeté in 2004 and 2007. The 2016 harvest yielded 300 gallons, which has
resulted in 1,344 bottles, exactly 112 cases (12 x 750ml bottles).

My grandfather would always tell me, “great wine starts with
finding the ideal vineyard site,” which is a lot easier said than
done. | walked a lot of vineyards before finding Skyfall, named
for the massive car-sized boulders scattered among the vines
that literally look like they fell from the sky. These boulders
were brought by glacial floods of the last Ice Age along with

silt loam soils now layered with ancient volcanic ash. The
complexity of these soils is ideal for cultivating optimal flavors
in the grapes, making Skyfall a perfect vineyard site.

For over four generations, our family has been
farming in the Yakima Valley. With a great love
for the land, our founder H. Lloyd Miller planted
trees throughout his farm. Over the years most of
the original trees disappeared, with the exception
of one Lone Birch, which stands at the corner of
our vineyard. With many years on its roots, this
tree has become a symbol of strength for our
farm. It provides shade to workers, direction to
lost travelers, inspiration to our family, and serves
as a reminder of our commitment to care for

the land. Learn more about our wines and our
commitment to stewardship and sustainability at
www.lonebirchwines.com.

2016 VIOGNIER DOUX

Calera 2016 Viognier Doux comes entirely from 100% Viognier
grapes organically grown from our Mt. Harlan Vineyard.

We crafted this very sweet wine in homage to the
brilliant, frozen-on-the-vine Eisweins that have been
produced for centuries in winter in the coldest vineyard
sites of Germany, Austria and now Canada.

Unlike those rare (and super-expensive) classics, this
Viognier Doux was made from the same grapes, picked
on October 18, 2016, that would become our 2016 Mt.
Harlan Viognier, which is completely dry (no sugar).
The juice was then frozen solid and sct aside for several
months. Slow thawing allowed us to concentrate the
juice from 25° brix to 37° brix. The juice was then
fermented with native yeast until it decided to stop,
with a sweetness level of 14% RS, giving us a wine with
an intense aroma of apricots, a full, unctuous, silky
texture and a lively, bright, floral finish.

After hand harvesting, the whole grape clusters were pressed and the juice
was moved by gravity to Calera’s barrel cellar. Fermentation in barrels by
native yeasts was followed by complete malolactic fermentation. The
wine was aged without racking in French oak barrels, 10% new, for ten
months, The separate vineyard lots were combined prior to bottling.

finding the ideal vineyard site,” which is a lot easier said than

2009 CHARDONNAY CENTRAL COAST

Calera’s 2009 Central Coast Chardonnay is made from grapes grown by the
following selected vineyards in California’s Central Coast Viticultural Area:

Scheid Vineyard Monterey County 39%
Lone Oak Vineyard Monterey County 28%
San Felipe Vineyard Santa Clara County 17%
Kellner Vineyard Santa Clara County 13%
Besson Vineyard Santa Clara County 3%

After hand harvesting, the whole grape clusters were pressed and the juice
was moved by gravity to Calera’s barrel cellar.

Fermentation in barrels by native yeasts was followed by complete
malolactic fermentation, The wine was aged without racking in French oak
barrels, 10% new, for ten months. The separate vineyard lots were
combined prior to bottling.

Los Caviervos Napa Valley

This “Méthode Ancienne” bottling was made using the most basic of winemaking techniques, those

wilized in Burgunely prior to the age of modern machines, Hand-picked whole clusters were simply

piled into a French oak open top fermenter; then subjected to pigeage (treading by foot) by a virgin

(okay, maybe she was, maybe she wasn't...we dida’t ask) several times a day until fermentation was

complete. As usual, we depended on native yeast. This wine was bottled unfined and unfiltered.

Soil Type: Haire clay loam Barrel Aging: 20 months, 40% new French oak

Year Planted: 1994 Farming: CCOF certified organic

coaxing out effusive aromas and flavors of anise,
raspberry, white pepper, and pink grapefruit.

414:
2013 VIOGNIER DOUX
Calera 2013 Viognier Doux comes entirely from 100% Viognier
grapes grown by our close neighbor Ken Gimellt, located 1 mile
from our winery here in San Benito County, California.
We crafted this very sweet wine in homage co the
brilliant, frozen-on-the-vine Eisweins that have been
produced for centuries in winter in che caldesc vineyard
sites of Germany, Austria and now Canada.
Unlike those rare (and super-expensive) classics, this
Viognier Doux was made from the same grapes, picked
on September 25, 2013, that would become our 2013
Central Coast Viognier, which is completely dry (no
sugar). The juice was then frozen solid and set aside for
several months. Slow thawing allowed us to concentrate
the juice from 25° brix to 37° brix. The juice was then
fermented with native yease until ic decided co stop,
with a sweetness level of 16% RS, giving us a wine with
an intense aroma of apricots, a full, unctuous, silky
texture and a lively, bright, floral finish.

EpNA VALLEY
In the Edna Valley, near San Luis Obispo our
vines are never far from the influence of the sea.
Sunny afternoons yield daily to brisk marine
breezes, and our climate is directly shaped by the
seasonal currents of the Pacific Ocean. Even our
soils of calcareous shale and coarse sand were
uplifted from the ancient sea floor and weathered
into place over the millennia. Fossil Point pays
tribute to this bond between sea and vine.

VALLEY
VINEYARDS

2015 dry ROSE of SANGIOVESE

 

Small Sangiovese vineyards are farmed exclusively for this rosé.

Heavy pruning promotes even ripening while maintaining
acidity and minerality in the grapes. We leave the juice in
contact with the skins for a few hours to achieve the perfect pink
hue, then cold ferment in stainless steel to maintain the bright
flavors. Our dry Rosé of Sangiovese jumps out of the glass with
intense aromatics and is rich and full bodied with big flavors of
strawberry, watermelon, raspberry and mint. The Wetzel
Family Estate, located on the property settled in the 1840s by
Alexander Valley namesake Cyrus Alexander, showcases the
history, tradition and excellence of the region.

This “Méthode Ancienne” bottling was made using the most basic of winemaking techniques

utilized prior to the age of modern machines. Hand-picked whole clusters were simply piled into a

French oak open top fermenter, then subjected to pigeage (treading by foot) several times a day until

fermentation was complete. As usual, we depended 0 on native yeast. This wine was bottled unfi ued
and unfiltered.

MIS EN BOUTEILLE A LA PROPRIETE
Domaine Séguinot-Bordet is one of the most renowned families in the
Chablis region, having produced fine wines since 1590. Complete
devotion to the art of transforming ripe Chardonnay grapes into deli-
cious, age-worthy bottled wines, without compromise, is the goal. The
current winemaker, young Jean-Frangois Bordet, has taken the quality
Icvel to new heights. By employing a revolutionary new cylindrical-
shaped horizontal fermentation tank, the grape juice makes more com-
plete contact with the skins and lees to provide extra body, fruit, and
general flavor intensity. All the wines boast riveting fruit and bracing,
yet well-integrated acidity levels-incontestable hallmarks of genuine

Chablis wine.

477:
2015 PINOT NOIR CENTRAL COAST

Calera’s 2015 Central Coast Pinot Noir is made from grapes grown by the following
selected vineyards in California’s Central Coast Viticultural Area:

Laetitia Vineyard San Luis Obispo County 44%
Bien Nacido Vineyard Santa Barbara County 25%
Sierra Madre Vineyard Santa Barbara County 13%
Chila Vina Vineyard Monterey County 6%
Pedregal Vineyard San Benito Gounty 6%
Solomon Hills Vineyard Santa Barbara County 6%

After hand harvesting, the grapes were fermented with native yeast in
small open-top fermenters. After fourteen days, the wines were pressed,
settled overnight, and then moved by gravity to Calera’s barrel cellar. The
wine was aged without racking in French oak barrels, 10% new, for eleven
months. The individual barrel lots were combined prior to bottling.

sculpted eastern Washington's Columbia Valley, leaving in their wake deep deposits
of sandy, rocky, alluvial soils. Today, framing the Columbia River, broad. plains of
ancient sediment constitute one of the world’s finest wine grape growing regions.

Our Gravel Bar Columbia Valley AVA Adluvial Red Blend is handcrafted in small lots
and aged 14 to 18 months sur lic in American Oak. Full-bodied, with vibrant flavors
of black cherry, clove and spice. Complex and concentrated.

The photo that graces the label is that of my great Grandfather
Salvatore Dindia and his fine horse Bess. Together they brought
fresh produce to the Yamhill Market in Portland, Oregon. Every fall
he took great pleasure in making wine to be enjoyed at gatherings
and celebrations with family and friends. The tradition continues, a
passion for growing grapes and making wine. At Nemarniki Vineyard,
our small production and sustainable farming practices ensure quality
as well as respect for our Earth. ‘The fine tradition of raising a glass
with family and friends continues at your table.

excellence and the Count’s vision with this red
wine blend. The deep color leads to rich aromas
of black currant and cherries.

My father’s name was Joseph,
but his friends just called him JOSH

Watching my Dad in his workshop, I learned the value of making something special
with your own hands, J handcrafted the first vintage of Josh Cellars to enjoy with
my family and closest friends, and I named it after my dad. My latest release, the

Craftsman's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon, is rich with blackcurrant, black cherry

and toasty oak, and is true to that first vintage. The wine is expressive and bold, but
smooth and approachable. It's a wine we carefully craft to pair with fine food and

great company, I think Dad would be proud.
